definition: to support with the hand/to help sb up/to support oneself by holding onto something/to help

sentences.english: An increasing number of experts believe migrlittle irritates willexert positive effects on construction of city .
sentences.chinese: 越來越多的專家信託移民對都邑的扶植起到主動作用。

sentences.english: That compelled the military to intervene, installing a caretaker government.
sentences.chinese: 那種局面迫使軍方介入，扶植起一個看守政府。

sentences.english: That or a contingent of US military, also hand picked by Bush 41.
sentences.chinese: 美國陸軍分遣隊也是由41任布什親手扶植起來的。

sentences.english: An linke with the modern Chinese history is helpful to the study of Chinese revolution.
sentences.chinese: 懂得一下中國近代史，對研究中國反動是有扶植的。

sentences.english: China ought to prop up the pro-China regimes and forces around the world, and consolidate its allies.
sentences.chinese: 中國應該全球範圍內扶植親中政權和勢力，廣結盟友。

sentences.english: The leaves of L. sativa, used especially in salads.
sentences.chinese: 一種萵苣屬植物，尤指萵苣，因葉可食用而扶植。

sentences.english: A chow chow named Cody is groomed before the show on Feb. 13.
sentences.chinese: 一個名爲鬆獅扶植科迪是2月13日之前的表演。

sentences.english: Any of various plants of the genus Lactuca, especially L. sativa, cultivated for their edible leaves.
sentences.chinese: 一種萵苣屬植物，尤指萵苣，因葉可食用而扶植。

sentences.english: "New farmer insurance is even timelier than the help from my son, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 他說“新農民安全比我兒子的扶植更及時”。

definition: to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to check and balance (power)/checks and balances
to form an alliance/to ally oneself with/allied with/aligned/to bond with
to rely on help from sb
to wield (political etc) power/be in power
to overthrow/downfall/to fall from power/to go bankrupt
